revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=2Wire |model=3600 |revision=HGV |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=08/11/2008 |manuf_country=China |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,dsl modem |fcc_id=PGR2W3800HP |ic_id=3439B-3800HGV |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.9 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=2Wire |cpu1_model=Ares;3001-000485-003 U; |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand=Ikanos |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=32 |fla1_brand=Hynix |fla1_model=HY27US08561A-TPCB |fla2=2 |fla2_brand=Eon |fla2_model=EN29LV160BB-70TIP |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4H511638G-LCCC |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR2413A |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Lantiq |sw_model=ADM6996M |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags=VDSL |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=2WIREXXX |default_ssid_regex=^2WIRE[0-9]{3}$ |default_ip=192.168.1.254 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=28:16:2E,3C:EA:4F |oui_eth=28:16:2E,3C:EA:4F }} Multiple labels printed with "727-008-048 (ARES)" are affixed to the board in the FCC photos. *FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/PGR2W3800HP PGR2W3800HP] covers both the 3600HGV and the 3800HGV-B. :CPU: [[2Wire]] ''TriMedia'' Perseus EC575543C-1L
Noted units.. *Assembly Number: 4200-001058-000 **3C:EA:4F OUI ('''2Wire''') **28:16:2E OUI ('''2Wire''')
* The default SSID is, the same as all other known ''[[2Wire]]'' devices, :''2WIREXXX'' where ''XXX'' is the last three digits of the serial number.
The Flash shown in the FCC photos may be a K9F5608U0D-PCB0 (32MB).
*[http://hackingbtbusinesshub.wordpress.com/2011/09/12/the-2wire-family-of-tm32-cpus/ ''The family of TriMedia TM32 CPUs'' - Hacking the 2Wire] *[http://hackingbtbusinesshub.wordpress.com/category/perseus/ ''Discovering 2Wire card edge pinout (for JTAG/I2C)'' - Hacking the 2Wire]
